fc7729174255.title: I always thought it was a bit weird that people enjoy the scent of paper with such intensity.

paragraphs.text: I always thought it was a bit weird that people enjoy the scent of paper with such intensity. Seriously, how does that compete so well with a medium that let’s readers tab out to check points of interest, brush up on definitions, and doesn’t close on you with the slightest breeze? Also an interesting point, while a book is made from dead trees, a tablet is made from dead ancient trees and/or dinosaur.
paragraphs.name: 12b0

82cc6af5c9cb.title: Identifying too strongly with any one activity is a no-go for me.

paragraphs.text: Identifying too strongly with any one activity is a no-go for me. Like, it’s cool that you ride a bike or read books or cook or whatever, but if they’re talking a whole lot about loving the activity rather than the activity itself? Something is real fishy about that, like they’re crafting a narrative about their ideal self rather than actually telling me something meaningful about them.

6e6b4527b9.title: Loving read and waxing overly passionately about the physicality of the book are, of course, two…

paragraphs.text: Loving read and waxing overly passionately about the physicality of the book are, of course, two different things. I do love to read. It’s my profession. The truth is, fewer than 25% of the population (and I think it is much lower than that) read a book in the last 12 months. A book. On anything. (Not just a novel — hey, there are lots of folks that…

f3ea6e777b03.title: I am good with smell-of-books raptures; better than, actually.

paragraphs.text: I am good with smell-of-books raptures; better than, actually. Were I single, I would call for the check only if he then wrecked it by saying these two words: “James Patterson.” Just do not say those two words to any librarian you want to impress for any reason. Trust me. Also “Debbie Macomber.” Full list of lightweight hacks available upon request.

86e3d9795333.title: Ehhhh I’d rather date someone who’s a little douchey about reading than someone who doesn’t read.

paragraphs.text: Ehhhh I’d rather date someone who’s a little douchey about reading than someone who doesn’t read. Not because they’re morally inferior, but because I like to read, and things go better if we can spend time quietly reading together.
